senses.de: To demand, request, or ask for something you believe you have a right to
senses.ex: She claimed her rightful place as the new CEO.

Tips.title: Entitlement Expression
Tips.description: Use 'claim' to express a strong belief in your entitlement to something.
Tips.example: After years of hard work, he claimed the promotion as his due.

Tips.title: Assertive Tone
Tips.description: When demanding something, 'claim' has an assertive, confident tone.
Tips.example: She walked in and claimed the best seat without hesitation.

senses.de: To state or express that something is true, even though it may not be proven
senses.ex: The company claims that their new product is a game changer.

Tips.title: Truth Assertion
Tips.description: 'Claim' suggests that a truth is stated, but leaves room for doubt or challenge.
Tips.example: He claimed to have seen a UFO, but had no evidence.

Tips.title: Requires Evidence
Tips.description: Remember that a 'claim' may invite skepticism unless supported by facts.
Tips.example: The scientist claimed a major discovery, pending peer review.

senses.de: A demand or request for something one believes they have a right to
senses.ex: He made a claim for compensation after the accident.

Tips.title: Rightful Request
Tips.description: Use 'claim' as a noun to emphasize a rightful or legal request for something.
Tips.example: He submitted his claim for a refund promptly.

senses.de: A statement that something is true, especially one that is disputed
senses.ex: Investors are skeptical about the entrepreneur's bold claims.

Tips.title: Challenged Statement
Tips.description: A 'claim' may be questioned or disputed, suggesting it's not universally accepted.
Tips.example: Her claim to the invention is under dispute by her colleague.

senses.ex: She claimed her luggage at baggage claim.

Tips.title: Personal Possession
Tips.description: The verb 'claim' often deals with retrieving what is already yours or allocated to you.
Tips.example: At the end of the flight, passengers rushed to claim their baggage.

senses.de: To legally demand as a right
senses.ex: They claimed asylum based on political persecution in their home country.

Tips.title: Legal Context
Tips.description: In legal language, 'claim' indicates a formal demand for a right or entitlement.
Tips.example: Their family decided to claim the estate through a legal process.

Tips.title: Cultural Sensitivity
Tips.description: Be aware of cultural and political nuances when discussing 'claiming' asylum or territory.
Tips.example: The activists claimed the land for their community, sparking debate.

Affirm.wordDefinition:
Affirm means to state something as true, especially in a confident or strong way.

It is typically used when someone is confirming something they believe in or agree with. An example would be saying "I affirm that I am a hard worker" or "I affirm my loyalty to my country".

Affirm is used when you are confident in a statement or belief, and claim is used when you are making an argument or statement that still needs to be proven.

Allege.wordDefinition:
Both allege and claim refer to making a statement or accusation, but there is a slight difference in their usage.

Allege means to make an accusation without necessarily having proof or evidence to support it. For example, "The police allege that the suspect robbed the bank.".

Allege is used more in legal or formal contexts, while claim is used in everyday language.

Assert.wordDefinition:
Assert means to state a fact or belief with confidence and force.

It is used when you are certain about something and you want to make it clear to others. For example, "I assert that the Earth revolves around the sun.".

Assert is used when you are confident and have evidence to back up what you are saying, while claim is used when you believe something to be true but may not have the proof to fully support it.

Contend.wordDefinition:
Contend means to argue or assert that something is true with evidence or proof.

For example, if someone says "I claim to have seen a UFO," they are stating this without any proof. But if someone says "I contend that the Earth is round because there is scientific evidence to support it," they are presenting evidence to support their argument.

Declare.wordDefinition:
Declare means to make an official announcement or to state something clearly and definitively.

It is often used in situations where there is no doubt or dispute, such as declaring a winner in a contest or declaring a major in college.

Claim is used when there is a possibility of disagreement or negotiation, whereas declare is used when something is certain and no further discussion is needed.

Demand.wordDefinition:
Demand means to ask for something forcefully or with authority. For example, if you ask someone to give you their phone because you need it urgently, you can demand that they give it to you.

You can use claim when you want to state that something is yours or that something is true, while you can use demand when you want to ask for something strongly or with authority.

Maintain.wordDefinition:
Maintain means to continue to say or do something that you have already said or done, often with confidence that it is true.

For example, if you maintain a healthy lifestyle, you continue to eat well and exercise regularly.

Claim is used when someone is making a statement or assertion without necessarily having all the facts to back it up, while maintain is used when someone is continuing to hold a position or stance that they have already taken.

Proclaim.wordDefinition:
Proclaim means to publicly declare or announce something, often in a formal or authoritative manner. For instance, one might proclaim a new law or proclaim a political ideology.

The main difference between these two words is that claim is used when one demands or asserts their right on something while proclaim is more about making a public declaration.

State.wordDefinition:
State means to express something formally, officially, or explicitly.

For example: "I state that the Earth orbits around the sun."

If you want to make a statement that can be backed up with evidence, use "state."

quotes.Text: The reality is that it would be wiser and even kinder for politicians to be responsible about what they claim the NHS will do, because the pain of having raised expectations for parents who are desperate to start a family, only to see those hopes crushed, is more cruel than having said nothing at all.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: Grant Shapps

quotes.Text: I don't claim to be an expert on love. I'm just a woman who has experienced a lot of things, and I want to share and hopefully my sharing will help make your situation better, because that's the goal.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Niecy Nash

quotes.Text: Everyone has to learn how to live in an environment that has not made it easy for women to claim their place, so I think it's all women's responsibility to step forward.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Jessica Chastain

quotes.Text: Seriously though, most films worth their salt will have something to say about the world we live in. Even 'Avatar' claimed that!
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Helen Baxendale

quotes.Text: A great player can win, but cannot claim titles alone. You need to have a great team who are close and able to support you.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Coach
quotes.Name: Zico

quotes.Text: I can't claim my grandfather's work has influenced mine directly, but his life certainly inspired me to follow this path.
quotes.Title: Scottish Director
quotes.Name: Kevin Macdonald

quotes.Text: When you are winning a war almost everything that happens can be claimed to be right and wise.
quotes.Title: British Statesman
quotes.Name: Winston Churchill

quotes.Text: Science never gives up searching for truth, since it never claims to have achieved it.
quotes.Title: Hungarian Scientist
quotes.Name: John Polanyi

quotes.Text: I don't have a Pollyana attitude toward life that claims everything is lovely.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Eve Arden

quotes.Text: Claiming your life for yourself feels like a huge deal until you do it.
quotes.Title: American Publisher
quotes.Name: Jonathan Galassi
